docs.snippet: The Federal Reserve Bank announced yesterday that exports of gold through the Port of New York in the week ended on Wednesday totaled $29,229,000. The bank's summary omitted the destination of $7,729,000 of the gold, and there was considerable...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve Bank announced yesterday that exports of gold through the Port of New York in the week ended on Wednesday totaled $29,229,000. The bank's summary omitted the destination of $7,729,000 of the gold, and there was considerable conjecture in Wall Street as to what country received this metal.

headline.main: $29,229,000 IN GOLD EXPORTED IN WEEK; Wall Street Believes $7,729,000 Went to France--Flow From Canada Continues. Savings Association Re-elects.

headline.main: THE TWO AMERICAS TIED BY BONDS OF GOLD; Growth of United States Investments South of the Rio Grande From One to Five Billion Dollars Since 1912 Is Emphasized by the President's Visit to Havana--Our Great Holdings Analyzed New Ties Between the Americas. Dollars: A Promise and a Danger. Our Holdings Top All Others. Variety of Our Interests. ARGENTINA BOLIVIA BRAZIL CHILE COLOMBIA CUBA TIES OF THE AMERICAS MEXICO PERU URUGUAY. VENEZUELA ECUADOR--PARAGUAY CENTRAL AMERICA

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP).--A favorable trade balance for the United States of $881,707,000 last year was announced today by the Commerce Department, which fixed exports at $4,866,160,000 and imports at $4,184,453,000. The balance in favor of the United States in 1926 was...

headline.main: DECEMBER'S GOLD EXPORT $77,849,000; Year's Imports Exceed Exports, But 'Earmarkings' Make Net Gold Loss $151,000,000. MERCHANDISE EXPORT DOWN December's Shipments $56,000,000 Below 1926, but Whole Year's Exports $58,500,000 Above Preceding Year.

docs.snippet: It is not surprising that Great Britain is watching the Havana Conference with unusual interest. Anything which may affect the relations of the United States with the Latin-American States is of interest to the British if for no other reason than...
docs.lead_paragraph: It is not surprising that Great Britain is watching the Havana Conference with unusual interest. Anything which may affect the relations of the United States with the Latin-American States is of interest to the British if for no other reason than that they have so long had such close business relations with Latin America.
